title: Pence says NBA operating as a subsidiary of China’s ‘authoritarian regime’
text:
Vice President Mike Pence slammed the NBA Thursday, saying it was “silencing free speech” in the wake of a since-deleted tweet from the Houston Rockets general manager showing support for Hong Kong.

"In siding with the Chinese Communist Party and silencing free speech, the NBA is acting like a wholly owned subsidiary of the authoritarian regime,” Pence said during remarks on U.S.-China relations at the Wilson Center in Washington. “Some of the NBA’s biggest players and owners, who routinely exercise their freedom to criticize this country, lose their voices when it comes to the freedom and rights of other peoples.”

Pence also criticized Nike for removing Houston Rockets merchandise from its shelves in China. Nike "promotes itself as a so-called social-justice champion, but when it comes to Hong Kong, it prefers checking its social conscience at the door,” Pence said.
